content:
TITLE: Quick Start Example of Baserow Client Usage
DESCRIPTION: A basic example demonstrating how to initialize the Baserow client, retrieve workspace information, and create a new row in a table.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
import { BaserowClient } from "@watzon/baserow";

// Initialize the client
const client = new BaserowClient({
  url: "https://api.baserow.io",
  token: "YOUR_API_TOKEN",
  // Optional: tokenType defaults to "Token", can be "JWT" for JWT tokens
  tokenType: "Token",
});

// Basic example: Get workspace list
const workspaces = await client.workspace.getAll();
console.log(workspaces);

// Example: Create a row in a table
const newRow = await client.databaseRows.create(
  tableId, 
  { field_1: "Value 1", field_2: "Value 2" }
);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Baserow Client API Structure Examples
DESCRIPTION: Example code snippets demonstrating the logical organization of the Baserow client API into operation groups for health checks, admin operations, workspace operations, and database row operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// Health check operations
client.health.getFullHealthCheck();

// Admin operations
client.admin.getUserList();

// Workspace operations
client.workspace.getAll();

// Database row operations
client.databaseRows.getAll(tableId);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example Database Table Operation Test
DESCRIPTION: Sample test implementation for Baserow database table operations using the mock server. Demonstrates setup of the client with the mock server URL and testing a list tables operation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/docs/media/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
describe('DatabaseTableOperations', () => {
  let client: BaserowClient;
  let tableOps: DatabaseTableOperations;
  
  beforeAll(() => {
    // The client will use the mock server URL from the environment or the default
    client = new BaserowClient({
      url: process.env.MOCK_SERVER_URL || 'https://cda62bdf-0231-4eac-932b-ec788095746a.mock.pstmn.io', 
      token: 'fake-token'
    });
    tableOps = client.databaseTables;
  });
  
  it('should list tables', async () => {
    const result = await tableOps.list(1);
    
    expect(Array.isArray(result.results)).toBe(true);
  });
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Database Table Operations Test Example
DESCRIPTION: Example TypeScript test implementation for Database Table operations using the Baserow client. Shows setup of mock client and basic table listing test.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/src/test/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
describe('DatabaseTableOperations', () => {
  let client: BaserowClient;
  let tableOps: DatabaseTableOperations;
  
  beforeAll(() => {
    // The client will use the mock server URL from the environment or the default
    client = new BaserowClient({
      url: process.env.MOCK_SERVER_URL || 'https://cda62bdf-0231-4eac-932b-ec788095746a.mock.pstmn.io', 
      token: 'fake-token'
    });
    tableOps = client.databaseTables;
  });
  
  it('should list tables', async () => {
    const result = await tableOps.list(1);
    
    expect(Array.isArray(result.results)).toBe(true);
  });
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Baserow Client in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing the Baserow client package in Node.js using npm, yarn, or pnpm package managers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Using npm
npm install @watzon/baserow

# Using yarn
yarn add @watzon/baserow

# Using pnpm
pnpm add @watzon/baserow
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing Baserow Client in Deno
DESCRIPTION: Example code showing how to import the Baserow client from npm registry in a Deno script.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
// Import from npm registry in your script
import { BaserowClient } from "npm:@watzon/baserow";
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Baserow Client in Bun
DESCRIPTION: Command for installing the Baserow client package in the Bun JavaScript runtime.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bun install @watzon/baserow
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Baserow Client Examples with ts-node or Bun
DESCRIPTION: Commands for executing individual example files using either ts-node or Bun runtime environments. These commands allow developers to run specific examples from the command line.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/examples/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Using ts-node
npx ts-node examples/database-rows.ts

# Using Bun
bun examples/database-rows.ts
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Multiple Baserow Examples via Index File
DESCRIPTION: Commands for executing the index.ts file which can run one or all examples at once. This provides a convenient way to test multiple examples in sequence.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/examples/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Using ts-node
npx ts-node examples/index.ts

# Using Bun
bun examples/index.ts
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Custom Mock Server
DESCRIPTION: Commands to configure tests with a custom mock server or real Baserow instance by setting environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/src/test/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Set custom mock server URL
MOCK_SERVER_URL=https://your-custom-mock.example.com bun test

# Test against a real Baserow server
MOCK_SERVER_URL=https://your-baserow-instance.example.com bun test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Custom Mock Server
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set environment variables for using a custom mock server or real Baserow instance during testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/docs/media/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Set custom mock server URL
MOCK_SERVER_URL=https://your-custom-mock.example.com bun test

# Test against a real Baserow server
MOCK_SERVER_URL=https://your-baserow-instance.example.com bun test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Tests with Bun
DESCRIPTION: Commands for running all tests or specific test files using the Bun test runner.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/docs/media/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Run all tests
bun test

# Run specific test file
bun test src/test/health-operations.postman.test.ts
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Tests with Bun
DESCRIPTION: Commands for running all tests or specific test files using Bun test runner.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/src/test/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Run all tests
bun test

# Run specific test file
bun test src/test/health-operations.postman.test.ts
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with Bun
DESCRIPTION: Command to install required dependencies for the Baserow API client test suite using Bun package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/docs/media/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Install dependencies
bun install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with Bun
DESCRIPTION: Command to install project dependencies using Bun package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/watzon/baserow-client/blob/main/src/test/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Install dependencies
bun install
```
